title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots could release Stefon Diggs to save $16.8 million, despite his strong connection with quarterback Drake Maye.
Mack Hollins, DeMario Douglas, and Kayshon Boutte may face cuts or trades to adjust the Patriots' salary cap.
Linebacker Christian Elliss possibly on the chopping block, could save the team money with his $8.5 million cap hit.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in Sunday's game against the 76ers as he recovers from a right Achilles injury.
Philadelphia 76ers' Joel Embiid will miss the game with an oblique strain and is out for three games.
The Celtics are 1-2 against the 76ers this season, with each game decided by two points or less.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran has hit three home runs in the first week of Red Sox spring training, including two against the Twins.
Duran has struggled against left-handed pitchers historically but hit home runs off lefties Kendry Rojas and Chris Sale recently.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora is considering Duran for a designated hitter role, complicating Wilyer Abreu's projected lineup spot.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens and Dean Letourneau combine for 39 goals at Boston College, boosting Bruins' prospect pool.
Bruins' seven drafted players faced off in BC vs. BU hockey match, BU won 3-1; Letourneau scored for BC.
Bruins' prospects shine in college hockey as team rebuilds, retaining assets for future NHL contention.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed Western Conference assistant coach names Boston Celtics as the 'clear pick' to win Eastern Conference.
As of late February, Boston Celtics are 39-20, 5.5 games behind the 44-14 Detroit Pistons.
Jaylen Brown leads Celtics with 29.1 PPG; possible return of Jayson Tatum boosts playoff expectations.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The band's setlist featured a mix of Isbell's solo and group work, including hits and deep cuts.
Isbell's performance included covers of songs by Drive-By Truckers and The Rolling Stones.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers like Trey Hendrickson, Jaelan Phillips, or Odafe Oweh in free agency.
Raiders not eager to trade Maxx Crosby; seeking at least two first-round picks if they do, say reports.
Zion Young, Missouri edge rusher, is a potential Patriots draft target; recorded 6.5 sacks last season.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance plans to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS, owned by the merging companies, may partially integrate sports broadcasting following the acquisition.
NFL negotiations with streaming platforms may heat up, with Netflix seeking more live game rights after losing Warner Bros. Discovery bid.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are interested in acquiring A.J. Brown but find the Eagles' asking price too high.
Trading A.J. Brown before June 1 would cost the Eagles $44 million in dead money and cap space loss.
Patriots may try to keep Stefon Diggs and trade for Brown, potentially requiring contract restructuring.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts will transition from E-ZPass transponders to RFID-enabled windshield sticker tags starting Sunday, reducing costs.
The new stickers are cost-effective, estimated at 55 cents each, compared to $6.70 for traditional transponders.
The change is expected to save the state $7.4 million annually, with stickers provided to drivers at no cost.
